Its supposedly the hours you spend on each task thats given to you. I think its the time that you actually write code. Ex: one day you are given a task that takes all day but out of that 8 hour shift, you write code only 1 hour so you have 1 dev hour. Thats what i get out of it at least

<@U15HRTAHL>: ahhh yea prob

I'm terms of software, if I was a manager, I would say "Yo, I need this shit done by Friday. I don't care how much time it takes you, just get it done. If you think 1 week isn't long enough, let's talk about it."

Some weeks, they'll work 50 hours, most weeks they'll hopefully work 40, some they'll work <30. I think it's good for everyone that way. I get what I want done, and my employees don't waste their time masturbating in the bathroom after they're done with their work.
Win-win
lol
What do you guys think? Would that kind of model work?
I think it would be a great way to manage me, but I don't know if it would be good for anyone else.
